message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper deals with the problem of 3D pose estimation from 2D images, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed method does not require explicit point correspondences or matching features, which suggests it may also be relevant to robotics (cs.RO) where such techniques are often used for object recognition and manipulation. The use of a novel distance measure and minimisation technique suggests a focus on machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the application of the method to vehicle pose detection in real photographs suggests a possible connection to graphics (cs.GR) and image processing.
